column2: MINNESOTA DMV TEST
column4: Minnesota
column6: MN

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column6: they must not drive past this sign.
column8: they must turn around immediately.
column10: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column8: A road crosses the main highway ahead.

column2: 3. Before turning left, it is important to:
column4: swing to the right side of your lane.
column6: flash your headlights to alert the other drivers.
column8: yield to oncoming vehicles.
column10: sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 4. Work zone signs:
column4: mean that drivers should drive faster to get out of the work zone.
column6: mean that drivers must come to a complete stop and back up.
column8: provide information on road work or other temporary road conditions.
column10: mean that road conditions will improve soon.

column2: 5. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column4: replace
column6: work with
column8: fix

column2: 6. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a green light.

column2: 7. A broken white line:
column4: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column6: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column8: marks the right edge of the roadway.

column2: 8. You are driving in the left lane and want to change to the right lane. Before changing lanes, you should check your mirrors, signal and:
column4: accelerate slightly before looking around your vehicle.
column6: look over both shoulders for vehicles in front of you.
column8: look over your left shoulder.

column2: 9. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column6: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column8: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.
column10: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.

column2: 10. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column4: rectangle shaped.
column6: regulatory signs.
column8: diamond shaped.

column2: 11. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column8: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column10: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 12. This road sign is:
column4: a warning sign.
column6: a regulatory sign.
column8: a guide sign.

column2: 13. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: quick lane changes without a signal.
column6: chasing or challenging other drivers.
column8: All of the above.
column10: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.

column2: 14. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: Regulatory.
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column8: School ahead.

column2: 15. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column4: take precedence over
column6: must obey
column8: are less important than

column2: 16. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column4: check your side view mirror.
column6: check your rearview mirror.
column8: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.

column2: 17. To enter a freeway:
column4: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column6: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column8: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column10: drive slowly so you can check traffic.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: Double curve ahead.
column6: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column10: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 19. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: right turns are not allowed.
column6: there is an intersection ahead.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 20. If you begin to feel drowsy while driving, you should:
column4: stop driving.
column6: get an energy drink.
column8: open your window.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Slippery when wet
column6: Merging traffic
column8: Divided highway ends

column2: 22. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: vehicles from the left.
column6: vehicles from the right.
column8: vehicles from both directions.

column2: 23. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Only right turns are allowed.
column6: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 24. The picture shows:
column4: a reversible road sign.
column6: a no-right-turn sign.
column8: a railroad advance warning sign.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: Tow away zone
column6: Low shoulder
column8: Buggy warning

column2: 26. When approaching a railroad crossing drivers should:
column4: slow down.
column6: be ready to stop.
column8: look for a train.

column2: 27. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: stop, look left, then right, then left again.
column6: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.
column8: stop, look right, then left, then right again.
column10: follow the vehicle ahead of you.

column2: 28. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column4: slow down or move over safely.
column6: distance yourself from the situation.
column8: avoid making eye contact.

column2: 29. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column4: Try to move away safely.
column6: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.
column8: Remain calm and relaxed.

column2: 30. When you see this sign you should:
column4: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column6: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column8: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column10: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 31. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.
column6: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.
column8: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column10: pass slower vehicles on the right.

column2: 32. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: stop doing what they are doing.
column8: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column10: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.

column2: 33. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column4: It prevents skidding.
column6: Can help improve vehicle stability.
column8: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.

column2: 34. This road sign means:
column4: Lane change
column6: Crossroad
column8: Hospital parking ahead

column2: 35. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column6: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column8: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.

column2: 36. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column6: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column8: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column10: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.

column2: 37. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
column4: double
column6: increase
column8: maintain

column2: 38. When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
column4: turning your head and glancing over your shoulder.
column6: using the inside rearview mirror.
column8: checking the rearview and outside mirrors.

column2: 39. This road sign means:
column4: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column6: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column10: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.

column2: 40. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs:
column4: could multiply the effects of the alcohol.
column6: reduces the effects of the drug or medicine.
column8: reduces the effects of the alcohol.
column10: has no effect, they are different substances.
